com.stormpath.sdk.account
Interface Account

All Superinterfaces:
Deletable, Resource, Saveable
public interface Account
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable

An Account is a unique identity within a Directory. Accounts within a Directory or Group mapped to an Application may log in to that Application.

Since:
0.1

Method Detail

getUsername

String getUsername()
Returns the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the getEmail().

Returns:
the account's username, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

setUsername

void setUsername(String username)
Sets the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory. If you do not have need of a username, it is best to set the username to equal the getEmail().

An attempt to set a username that is in use when creating or saving the account will result in a Error

Parameters:
username - the account's username, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.

getEmail

String getEmail()
Returns the account's email address, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

Returns:
the account's email address, guaranteed to be unique for all accounts within a Directory.

setEmail

void setEmail(String email)
Sets the account's email address, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.

An attempt to set an email that is in use when creating or saving the account will result in a Error

Parameters:
email - the account's email address, which must be unique among all other accounts within a Directory.

setPassword

void setPassword(String password)
Sets (changes) the account's password to the specified raw (plaintext) password. ONLY call this method if you legitimately want to set the account password directly. It is usually more advisable to use Stormpath's account password reset email workflow (when possible).

After calling this method, you must call Saveable.save() to propagate the change to the Stormpath servers.

Parameters:
password - the account's new raw (plaintext) password.

getFullName

String getFullName()
Returns the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.

This is NOT a persistent/settable property. It is a convenience computed property combining the givenName (aka 'first name' in Western cultures) followed by the middleName (if any) followed by the surname (aka 'last name' in Western cultures).

Returns:
the account's 'full name', per Western cultural conventions.
Since:
0.8

getStatus

AccountStatus getStatus()
Returns the account's status. Accounts that are not ENABLED may not login to applications.

Returns:
the account's status.

setStatus

void setStatus(AccountStatus status)
Sets the account's status. Accounts that are not ENABLED may not login to applications.

Parameters:
status - the account's status.

getGroups

GroupList getGroups()
Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups.

Tip: If this list might be large, instead of iterating over all groups, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more of the account's groups using the getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) or getGroups(java.util.Map) methods instead of this one.

Returns:
a paginated list of all groups assigned to the Account.
See Also:
getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria), getGroups(java.util.Map)

getGroups

GroupList getGroups(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria.

This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

 def groups = account.getGroups([description: '*foo*', orderBy: 'name desc', limit: 50])
The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

 .../accounts/accountId/groups?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

If in doubt, use getGroups(com.stormpath.sdk.group.GroupCriteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.

Parameters:
queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
Returns:
a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.
Since:
0.8

getGroups

GroupList getGroups(GroupCriteria criteria)
Returns a paginated list of the account's assigned groups that match the specified query criteria. The Groups utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
 account.getGroups(Groups.where(
     Groups.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Groups.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
or, if you use static imports: 
 import static com.stormpath.sdk.group.Groups.*;

 ...

 account.getGroups(where(
      description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));

Parameters:
criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
Returns:
a paginated list of the account's groups that match the specified query criteria.
Since:
0.8

getDirectory

Directory getDirectory()
Returns the account's parent Directory (where the account is stored).

Returns:
the account's parent Directory (where the account is stored)

getTenant

Tenant getTenant()
Returns the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Account resource.

Returns:
the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Account resource.

getGroupMemberships

GroupMembershipList getGroupMemberships()
Returns all GroupMemberships that reflect this account. This method is an alternative to getGroups() that returns the actual association entity representing the account and a group.

Since:
0.4

addGroup

GroupMembership addGroup(Group group)
Assigns this account to the specified Group.

Immediate Execution: Unlike other Account methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will interact with the server immediately.

Returns:
the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the account-to-group association.
Since:
0.4

getEmailVerificationToken

EmailVerificationToken getEmailVerificationToken()
Returns the account's email verification token. This will only be non-null if the Account holder has been asked to verify their email account by clicking a link in an email.

Returns:
the account's email verification token.

getCustomData

CustomData getCustomData()
Returns the Stormpath CustomData owned by this Account resource.

Returns:
the Stormpath CustomData owned by this Account resource.
Since:
0.9

saveWithResponseOptions

void saveWithResponseOptions(AccountOptions responseOptions)
Saves this Account resource and ensures the returned Account response reflects the specified options. This enhances performance by 'piggybacking' the response to return related resources you know you will use after saving the account.

Parameters:
responseOptions - The AccountOptions to use to customize the Account resource returned in the save response.
Since:
0.9

isMemberOfGroup

boolean isMemberOfGroup(String hrefOrName)
Returns true if the account belongs to a group whose name or href is (case insensitive) equal to the specified hrefOrName value, false otherwise.

Parameters:
hrefOrName - the href or name of the group being sought.
Returns:
true if the account belongs to a group whose name or href is (case insensitive) equal to the specified hrefOrName value, false otherwise.
Since:
0.9.3
